content.description:
Stick clip the high first bolt and do a hard boulder to the 2nd bolt; guidebook calls this V8. After a quick chalk-up at a decent set of holds followed by a second boulder (V7ish) you will finally be able to have a breather on some incut holds at a left trending seam. Follow the seam to finish up the blunt arete to its lower-off anchor.

Slightly contrived, as traversing right to use any holds from nearby Brain Child would significantly lower the difficulty; nonetheless it climbs very well as an independent line.

There is a link-up to Brain Child/Apollo 13 that splits right from the incut holds at the upper seam.
content.location: Left-most face route on the north face of the Brain Block.

climbs.name: Rocket Brain (aka Rocket Child, Rocket Man)

content.description:
Boulder through the crux of Rocket Science to the 3rd bolt at a left-trending seam. Here, instead of clipping up and left as for Rocket Science, clip the "in-between" bolt on the right and then join Brain Child to its top.

Unsure of the grade, but it is noticeably harder than Apollo 13 but definitely easier than the original Rocket Science. Unfortunately the line is somewhat contrived, and the difficulty depends on how early you dabble into Brain Child.

I've also heard it being called Rocket Man or Rocket Child; take your pick.

Rocket 13 is a much harder link-up that tackles one more thin boulder problem after the crux of Brain Child.

The epitome of bouldering on a rope. Link the crux of Rocket Science into the crux of Brain Child into the crux of Apollo 13...you get the idea. Climbing Brain Child is your "rest."

Alan Moore did the FA on this link-up and called it 14a.
content.protection: Bolts, a long draw or two are helpful.

content.description: This fun chimney is in the corner at the left side of the East Face of Snowshed Wall.
content.protection: Best to top rope or solo.

content.description: Short but fun bolted arete.  Somewhat balancy, slappy moves with an interesting mantle.
content.location: Arete to the left of Brain Child

content.description: Link the opening moves of Brain Child into the left-trending seam of Rocket Science. A long draw on the second bolt of Brain Child would be helpful (or skip it and instead clip a long draw on the “in-between” bolt. A surprisingly good technical climb!
content.location: Start as for Brain Child; move left at the second bolt.

content.description:
Crazy good face climb on the East wall of Snowshed.

I learned how to thumb press on the initial vexing move.

Slightly overhanging edges and flakes lead to a bouldery crux near the 3rd bolt.  Save some gas for the top...don't blow the mantle...
content.location:
Just left of Rage Reduction is this gorgeous face.  Stick clip is not a bad idea.

Anchors at top; a bit sketch to set up a TR.

content.description:
Climb Brain Child through the 4th bolt and then instead of topping out the ledge, move right to clip one more bolt and boulder through the headwall.

For what it's worth, the FA did not use the right-side blunt arete near the top but some subsequent ascents have. Either way it's a hard (slightly contrived, about V8) boulder problem, and certainly stepping on the nearby wedged boulder or jamming its crack are both off limits.
